dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, I think a lot of people assume the Pfizer vaccine is only, like, 90% effective or something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, I think a lot of people assume the Pfizer vaccine is only, like, ninety percent effective or something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, actually, no—the latest data from Israel shows it's even better. They're reporting a 95.7% reduction in illness after both doses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, actually, no-the latest data from Israel shows it's even better. They're reporting a ninety five point seven percent reduction in illness after both doses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? That's incredible. And what about severe cases?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? That's incredible. And what about severe cases?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, hospitalization and death rates dropped by almost 99% for those fully vaccinated. It's uh, pretty remarkable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, hospitalization and death rates dropped by almost ninety nine percent for those fully vaccinated. It's uh, pretty remarkable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Israel's leading the way here, right? They've vaccinated over a third of their population already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Israel's leading the way here, right? They've vaccinated over a third of their population already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 32.4%. Thats the share of Israelis who are fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the New York Times tracker.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, 32.6% fully vaccinated as of last Saturday. That's way ahead of the U.S., which is still around 5%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, thirty two point six percent fully vaccinated as of last Saturday. That's way ahead of the U.S., which is still around five percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 32.4%. Thats the share of Israelis who are fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the New York Times tracker. The country ranks first in the world for vaccinations, compared to the United States 5.1% immunization rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So they're basically the world's biggest real-world test case at this point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're basically the world's biggest real-world test case at this point.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Public health authorities around the world are watching Israels progress closely, making the country the planets largest test case for the impact of mass-vaccination.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Even Dr. Fauci mentioned how impressed he is with their results.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Even Dr. Fauci mentioned how impressed he is with their results.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel has a remarkable diminution in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine, U.S. infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're already planning to reopen gyms and restaurants, but only for vaccinated people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're already planning to reopen gyms and restaurants, but only for vaccinated people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's kind of a two-tier system, but it makes sense from a public health perspective.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's kind of a two-tier system, but it makes sense from a public health perspective.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, there's that concern about new variants, right? Like the one in South Africa.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, there's that concern about new variants, right? Like the one in South Africa.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Researchers are still studying whether new coronavirus mutations could blunt vaccines effectiveness. Most drugmakers including Pfizer, Moderna, Johnson & Johnson and Novavax say their vaccine candidates are somewhat less effective at staving off the virus variant rapidly spreading in South Africa, though they still offer patients some protection.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Pfizer and others are working on boosters just in case, but so far the protection seems strong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Pfizer and others are working on boosters just in case, but so far the protection seems strong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, several companies are working on booster shots to combat emerging new strains.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's encouraging news though—gives me hope that we might actually see an end to this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's encouraging news though-gives me hope that we might actually see an end to this.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Cautious optimism, as they say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Cautious optimism, as they say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, experts say theres reason for cautious optimism: cases and hospitalizations have declined for several weeks.
